metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14629 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A denial of service vulnerability was discovered in Samba's LDAP server before versions 4.7.12, 4.8.7, and 4.9.3. A CNAME loop could lead to infinite recursion in the server. An unprivileged local attacker could create such an entry, leading to denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.19').
